Aidan Baker Collaborations.title: Laika World
Aidan Baker Collaborations.artist: Aidan Baker | Jack Chuter | Ryan Durfee
Aidan Baker Collaborations.about:
LAIKA WORLD is a collaborative album by Aidan Baker, Jack Chuter, and Ryan Durfee, created in tribute to Laika, the Soviet space dog who became the first animal to orbit Earth aboard Sputnik 2 on November 3, 1957.



The album is a sonic blend of diverse influences, including Dean Hurley, SpaceGhostPurrp, Starflyer 59, Emeralds, Flying Saucer Attack, painter Morris Graves, and the films of Renee Harmon and Takeshi Kitano. Birdsong detonates from within sweeps of reverbed guitar, synthesiser and hypnagogic vocal spill, while frenetic drums keep an intermittent sense of time.



Ideal for those who enjoy late-night conversations and the vivid dreams that follow.



Limited cassette available from Cruel Nature Recordings: 



cruelnaturerecordings.bandcamp.com/album/laika-world
Aidan Baker Collaborations.credits:
released October 25, 2024
            
            Aidan Baker - drums, percussion

Jack Chuter - guitar, voice, synth, samples

Ryan Durfee - field recordings, Korg WaveState, Koala

trackinfo.title: Where Will The Terriers Retire To When Florida Has Sunk Into The Sea

Aidan Baker Collaborations.title: FR/DE
Aidan Baker Collaborations.about:
Two live recordings from performances in France and Germany by BOW & Aidan Baker released as a limited cassette by Cruel Nature Recordings.



30.11.19 FR recorded by Fabien Leseure at Sulfure Festival, Le Vent Se Lève, Paris, France.



22.04.23 DE recorded by Christoph Scheidel (79 Sound) at Moving Noises Festival, Christuskirche, Bochum, Germany.



Mixed by Fabien Leseure. 



Cover photo by Olivier Calicis. 



www.bowquintet.com

  www.aidanbaker.org

  cruelnaturerecordings.bandcamp.com

Aidan Baker Collaborations.title: Thoughts of Trio
Aidan Baker Collaborations.artist: Aidan Baker | Han-earl Park | Katharina Schmidt
Aidan Baker Collaborations.about:
Thoughts of Trio documents a live-in-studio performance by Canadian guitarist Aidan Baker, Korean-American guitarist Han-earl Park, & German drummer/percussionist Katharina Schmidt. The group brings together their respective, disparate musical backgrounds to explore the intersections of ambient music, improvisational (free) jazz, and musique-concrète.



Recorded at Morphine Raum in Berlin, Germany on February 21, 2024 by Rabih Beaini.



Released on CD by Attenuation Circuit and cassette by Cruel Nature Recordings: 



emerge.bandcamp.com/album/thoughts-of-trio

  cruelnaturerecordings.bandcamp.com/album/thoughts-of-trio
Aidan Baker Collaborations.credits:
released December 6, 2024

Han-earl Park - guitar

Katharina Schmidt - drums/percussion

Aidan Baker Collaborations.about: A collaborative album of ambient/collage/drones originally released on limited CDr by Zhelezobeton ‎in 2008. The first two tracks previously appeared in 2002 on a release with Blade Records.

Aidan Baker Collaborations.title: Fragments
Aidan Baker Collaborations.about:
Fragmentary 4-track recordings from some indeterminate recording session in the early 2000s, never previously released, from no-longer active shoegaze trio Mnemosyne. A re-issue of the band's only full-length release from 2004 is forthcoming on LP from Beta-Lactam Ring Records and available digitally here: 



brokenspineprods.bandcamp.com/album/the-air-grows-small-fingers-drone-compendium-three

  www.blrrecords.com
Aidan Baker Collaborations.credits:
released December 2, 2014
            
            Aidan Baker - guitars

Richard Baker - drums

Rodin Columb - bass
